trans-unit.source: Appears as the root of the visual subtree generated for a group.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GroupItem> is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl>, which means that it can contain a single object of any type (such as a string, an image, or a panel).
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl> class.
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GroupItem"></xref> class.
Arranges the content of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GroupItem"></xref>.
The final area within the parent that the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GroupItem"></xref> should use to arrange itself and its children.
The actual sized used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GroupItem"></xref>.
Builds the visual tree for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GroupItem"></xref> when a new template is applied.
This method is invoked whenever application code or an internal process, such as a rebuilding layout pass, calls the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GroupItem.OnApplyTemplate%2A> method.
Creates and returns an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GroupItem"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GroupItem"></xref>.
Clears all property associations.
Removes the association between the specified item and property.
The associated item.
The associated property.
Removes the specified property from all property lists.
The property to remove.
Returns the value of the specified property that is associated with the specified item.
The item that has the specified property associated with it.
The property whose value to return.
The value of the specified property that is associated with the specified item.
Stores the specified property and value and associates them with the specified item.
The item to associate the value and property with.
The property that is associated with the specified item.
The value of the associated property.
Gets or sets an object that represents the sizes of the control's viewport and cache.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GroupItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IHierarchicalVirtualizationAndScrollInfo> interface.
An object that represents the sizes of the control's viewport and cache.
Gets an object that represents the desired size of the control's header.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GroupItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IHierarchicalVirtualizationAndScrollInfo> interface.
An object that represents the desired size of the control's header.
Gets a value that indicates whether the control's layout pass occurs at a lower priority.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GroupItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IHierarchicalVirtualizationAndScrollInfo> interface.
`true` if the control's layout pass occurs at a lower priority; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets an object that represents the desired size of the control's items.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GroupItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IHierarchicalVirtualizationAndScrollInfo> interface.
An object that represents the desired size of the control's items.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Panel"></xref> that displays the items of the control.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GroupItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IHierarchicalVirtualizationAndScrollInfo> interface.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Panel"></xref> that displays the items of the control.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the owning <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl"></xref> should virtualize its items.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GroupItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IHierarchicalVirtualizationAndScrollInfo> interface.
`true` if the owning <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl"></xref> should virtualize its items; otherwise, `false`.
